author: Melinda
title: Stay Beautiful with Cover Girl and Walmart #giveaway
text:
Giveaways / Stay Beautiful with Cover Girl and Walmart #giveaway Stay Beautiful with Cover Girl and Walmart #giveaway 07/13/2015 by Melinda 25 Comments 25 Flares Facebook 6 Google+ 8   4 Twitter 7 25 Flares × 
I’ve been told I have great skin. For as long as I can remember it’s been one of my best assets. Also for as long as I can remember I’ve been taking care of it simply by washing it and applying Oil of Olay moisturizer. I never thought I needed some fancy brand with a high price tag to get the results I always wanted. that doesn’t mean I haven’t tried other brands, I have, many; but I always go back to my tried and true Oil of Olay. 
On a recent trip to Walmart I found really great deals on my favorite beauty products. I’m not talking about a little bit of change in your pocket, I’m talking about MONEY SAVING deals that are worth the trip. 
P&G brands like Olay and Cover Girl are staples for a woman’s life. From beauty bars in the shower to LashBlast Volume Mascara on the vanity these brands are part of my every day. 
Here is my first use of LashBlast Mascara. Just 2 quick swips and I was ready for the day. If I was getting ready for date night or dinner with the girls I would’ve added a couple other swipes and a long wing of Cover Girl Perfect Point Plus Eyeliner Pencil. With its attached smudger tip I get that perfect smoky eye every time. 
Next time you go shopping for your fave beauty products check Walmart’s great selection and value. As an added bonus for being a LookWhatMomFound…and Dad too! reader we’re giving away a $25 Walmart gift card. 
Just let us know if you have an Olay or Cover Girl product that you grab for each morning to keep your skin and face beautiful and healthy.

For complete rules please read our blog contest rules page . 25 Flares Facebook 6 Google+ 8   4 Twitter 7 25 Flares × ← My only hair regret #SwitchersRemorse About Melinda 
Melinda is half of the mom & dad blogging team from LookWhatMomFound...and Dad too! Over 4 years ago Melinda left the corporate world to focus on raising her children while being a SAHM. With 17 years of parenting practice to 3 kids life has provided her many experiences that are used to educate the family on morals, ethics and the difference between right and wrong. While academics are very important, a full education goes beyond books and grades. Melinda strives to raise children with good hearts, strong principles and a foundation built on love and respect for others.
